title: State of Missouri ANnual Expenditure on electricity from 1970-1990

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: State of Missouri ANnual Expenditure on electricity from 1970-1990
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I am a student at Tulane University conducting research. Pursuant to the Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records: 
-Annual expenditures on electricity for the years 1970-1990
-A breakdown of these expenditures by state agency or department (if available)
-Any reports, invoices or statements related to electricity costs during the request period
- Any records that detail contracts, agreements, or negotiations with electircy suppliers or providers

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Khang Le
kle4@tulane.edu

title: Public Records Request for Mardi Gras Plastic Waste Management Information

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I am a student at Tulane University conducting research regarding the management of plastic waste generated during the city's Mardi Gras celebrations. To enhance the depth of my investigation, I kindly request access to public records that can provide insight into the waste disposal and recycling processes, strategies, and initiatives associated with Mardi Gras plastic waste.

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- State-level policies, guidelines, or documents related to the handling and disposal of plastic waste generated during Mardi Gras celebrations in Louisiana.
- Permits, licenses, or approvals issued by the Louisiana Department of Environmental Quality to entities involved in waste management and cleanup during Mardi Gras.
- Reports, correspondence, and communication related to environmental impact assessments of Mardi Gras plastic waste disposal and recycling methods in the state.
- Any records or reports detailing state-level initiatives, programs, or measures aimed at reducing the environmental impact of Mardi Gras plastic waste, as well as their effectiveness.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

{ Lexi Kessler }

communications.subject: Louisiana Public Records Law Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern, 

I am a student and Tulane University conducting research. Under the Louisiana Public Records Act, I am requesting an opportunity to obtain the records of communications between city officials and representatives of Airbnb rental homes from March 1, 2020 to the date of this request. With specific regards to the agreement referred to in the New York Times article titles: “New Orleans Becomes New Model for Airbnb to Work With Cities.” The said article acknowledges how Airbnb reached a deal with the City of New Orleans to legalize short-term rentals. I am requesting documents that support the terms of the deal presented in the article. 

One excerpt of the article that we request documents for emphasizes the statement “In New Orleans specifically, Airbnb agreed to share data — such as the names and addresses of its hosts — with the city, something the company has balked at doing elsewhere. Airbnb also agreed that its hosts must operate with a permit, with hosts automatically being registered with the city when they sign up to the service. In a nod to the local hotel industry, Airbnb will also ban almost all listings in the city’s historic French Quarter and set a 90-day annual cap for hosts who rent out entire homes.”
If there are any fees for searching or copying these records onto a compact disc, please inform me if the cost will exceed $50 (including any associated delivery/postage fees). This information is not being sought for commercial purposes.

Section 44:32(D) of the Louisiana Public Records Act requires a response within three business days. If access to the records I am requesting will take longer than that time period, please contact me with information about when I might expect electronic copies of the requested records.

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.
Please feel free to call or email me with any questions on this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexandra Kahn

title: Public Records Request for Mardi Gras Plastic Waste Management Information

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I am a student at Tulane University conducting research regarding the management of plastic waste generated during the city's Mardi Gras celebrations. To enhance the depth of my investigation, I kindly request access to public records that can provide insight into the waste disposal and recycling processes, strategies, and initiatives associated with Mardi Gras plastic waste.

Pursuant to the { Louisiana Freedom of Act }, I hereby request the following records:

- Internal policies, guidelines, or documents related to the handling and disposal of plastic waste during Mardi Gras festivities.
- Contracts, agreements, or Memoranda of Understanding (MOUs) between the - New Orleans Department of Sanitation and waste management companies or contractors responsible for Mardi Gras waste management.
- Communications, including emails, memos, and reports, exchanged between the New Orleans Department of Sanitation and relevant stakeholders (e.g., waste management companies) concerning Mardi Gras plastic waste management plans and strategies.
- Any records or reports detailing the methods employed for the disposal or recycling of plastic waste generated during Mardi Gras celebrations, including assessments of their environmental impact.
- Documentation related to initiatives, programs, or measures aimed at reducing the environmental impact of Mardi Gras plastic waste and promoting sustainability.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within { 4 business days }.

Sincerely,

{ Lexi Kessler }

title: Email correspondence regarding high-speed rail from Congressmen Ellzey and McCaul

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I am a student at Tulane University in New Orleans, LA, conducting research about lobbying initiatives against high-speed rail projects in the United States.

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:
(1)	E-mails sent from or received by Representative John “Jake” Ellzey Sr. (R-TX 6th District) containing one or more of the following keywords: “Southwest,” “SW,” “SWA,” “rail,” “railway,” “Texas Central,” or “Amtrak” from 2012 to Present Day. The search should include both interdepartmental and external communications from Congressman Ellzey’s government issued e-mail account.
(2)	E-mails sent from or received by Representative Michael Thomas McCaul (R-TX 10th District) containing one or more of the following keywords: “Southwest,” “SW,” “SWA,” “rail,” “railway,” “Texas Central,” or “Amtrak” from 2012 to Present Day. The search should include both interdepartmental and external communications from Congressman McCaul’s government issued e-mail account.

If this request is unclear, please contact me to allow revisions rather than deny the request. Similarly, if the requested data are available only in part, please fulfill the portion of the request that is available rather than denying it in full. For example, notes or reports are available/subject to release but personal identifying information are not, reply with the report summary and omit sensitive information.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Claire Henry

title: Information on Waste During Mardi Gras

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Information on Waste During Mardi Gras
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am a student at Tulane University conducting research.  
All reports and related materials regarding plastic waste in New Orleans between February 21, 2023, and March 1, 2023. Please include the following as responsive: 
Any data or studies conducted by the EPA regarding the amount of plastic waste generated during Mardi Gras celebrations in New Orleans. This includes data regarding the quantity of plastic waste. 
Any environmental impact assessments conducted by the EPA or reviewed by the EPA concerning the environmental consequences of Mardi Gras plastic waste. These studies include the impact of waste on the ecosystem, water, and wildlife. 
Information on the enforcement of environmental regulations during Mardi Gras. This includes actions taken against non-compliant groups and the penalties or fines involved.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request be filed electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

communications.subject: Louisiana Public Records Law Request: AirBnb and hosts
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I am a student at Tulane University conducting research.  

Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I'm writing to request access to public records about lawsuits in the city of New Orleans concerning Airbnb and hosts. Under the Louisiana Public Records Act Section 44:1 et seqI am asking for specific access to electronic records of correspondence between representatives of short-term rental platform companies and city officials. In my judgment, these documents are available for public access in accordance with Louisiana's Public Records Law, specifically the Louisiana Revised Statute. 
This should cover any correspondence—emails, letters, memos, texts, and other kinds of physical or digital communication—between Airbnb, and their representatives and city authorities who are creating regulations pertaining to short-term rentals.
This should include: 
- Any correspondence pertaining to the creation or implementation of ordinances governing short-term rentals in New Orleans.
- Any draft regulations or local policies that AirBnb and its representatives offer to the city officials
- Any information that Airbnb or their agents submit to the city about short-term rentals in New Orleans.
- Any final or draft agreements that the city enters into with Airbnb or their agents.
If there are any fees for searching or copying these records onto a compact disc, please inform me if the cost will exceed $50 (including any associated delivery/postage fees). This information is not being sought for commercial purposes.

Section 44:32(D) of the Louisiana Public Records Act requires a response within three business days. If access to the records I am requesting will take longer than that time period, please contact me with information about when I might expect electronic copies of the requested records.
If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.
Please feel free to call or email me with any questions on this request.
Sincerely, 
Annabel Slogoff

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Hurricane Katrina Public Archieves
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am a student at Tulane University filing a request under the Freedom of Information Act in regards to the failure of the levee system following Hurricane Katrina in 2005. I am requesting documents that are not already filed in the database about the allocation of money designated to residential homeowners due to the breakage of the levee system. I am additionally requesting documents and/or emails about the class action lawsuit that occurred in response to the levee system failing. I am also requesting data about the addresses who out of the class action lawsuit received a stipend, and what that looked like in residential communities. The hurricane and levee system failure were disastrous, but were followed by the stock market crash of 2008, so I would additionally request data about how that affected the rebuilding and rebranding of New Orleans during the market failure in 2007. I would appreciate receiving feedback in a timely manner and look forward to receiving a
response.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jonah Rosenstein

Any police records/documents pertaining to the arrest of underage individuals for alcohol consumption, and/or the possession of fake identifications by the Boston Police Department.  

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samantha Lever

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Incident Reports Involving Squeegee Workers
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records relating to or mentioning incidents involving squeegee workers within the city of Baltimore, particularly those occurring near major intersections and thoroughfares, for the period of January 2022 to November 2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

 I am a student at Tulane University conducting research. 

Sincerely,

Meghan Green
Mgreen16@tulane.edu
